Christine Wynn. Initial inventory edited by Katie Ehrlich.
Records of the Office of the Director of Academic Program Review (Barnett Hamberger)
Records of the Office of the Director of Academic Program Review (Barnett Hamberger)

This collection includes materials from the office of Barnett W. Hamberger, Director of Academic Program Review. The Office of Academic Affairs is responsible for new program registration with the New York State Education Department, as well as overseeing the academic affairs and compliance office serving the intercollegiate athletics program.

This collection includes materials from the office of Barnett W. Hamberger, Director of Academic Program Review. The Office of Academic Affairs is responsible for new program registration with the New York State Education Department, as well as overseeing the academic affairs and compliance office serving the intercollegiate athletics program.

The collection includes a variety of material about Coles Athletic Facilities, including budgets, advisory board reviews, student athlete information, athletic schedules, and awards. Also included in the records are accreditations, MSA reports, data surveys for various sectors of NYU, HEDS Reports, faculty resources network evaluation reports, and correspondence.
Please note: the contents of boxes 1, 2, 49, 56, 60, 67, 71, and 80 have been shifted to other boxes in the collection.

Barnett W. Hamberger is an Assistant Chancellor at New York University and heads the Office of Academic Program Review. New York University's Office of Academic Program Review is responsible for new program registration with the New York State Education Department, as well as monitoring changes to currently registered programs; administering the University's compliance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act; and overseeing the academic affairs and compliance office serving the intercollegiate athletics program.

Mr. Hamberger has been at NYU since 1965 holding a variety of positions including Director of Branch Campus Affairs, Assistant to the Vice President for Academic Planning, Assistant Vice Chancellor for Student Affairs, and as a faculty member.
This collection consists of multiple accessions from the Academic Program Review office.
